info.title: Microsoft NetApp

checkElasticVolumeFilePathAvailabilityRe.description: File path availability request content - availability is based on the elastic volume filePath within the given elastic capacityPool.

elasticResourceAvailabilityStatus.description: Current availability status of the resource.

values.name: Online
values.description: The resource is currently Online and accessible

values.name: Offline
values.description: The resource is currently Offline and not accessible

elasticAccountList.description: List of NetApp elastic account resources

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

keySource.description: The encryption keySource (provider). Possible values (case-insensitive):  Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault

values.description: Microsoft-managed key encryption
Customer-managed key encryption

keyVaultProperties.description: Properties provided by KeyVault. Applicable if keySource is 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

identity.description: Identity used to authenticate to KeyVault. Applicable if keySource is 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

values.description: KeyVault connection created but not in use
KeyVault connection in use by SMB Volume
KeyVault connection Deleted
Error with the KeyVault connection
KeyVault connection Updating

ElasticEncryptionIdentity.description: Identity used to authenticate with key vault.

principalId.description: The principal ID (object ID) of the identity used to authenticate with key vault. Read-only.

userAssignedIdentity.description: The ARM resource identifier of the user assigned identity used to authenticate with key vault. Applicable if identity.type has 'UserAssigned'. It should match key of identity.userAssignedIdentities.

values.name: NetApp
values.description: Represents the encryption key source of Elastic pool is Microsoft.NetApp

values.name: KeyVault
values.description: Represents the encryption key source of Elastic pool is Microsoft.KeyVault

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

elasticCapacityPoolSize.title: elasticCapacityPoolSize
elasticCapacityPoolSize.description: Provisioned size of the pool (in bytes). For zoneRedundant service level pool, value must be in the range 1TiB to 16TiB or 1TiB to 128TiB for supported region. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1TiB till 16TiB and in multiples of 8TiB from 24TiB to 128TiB. Pool size can't be shrunk once it is created.

elasticVolumeSize.title: elasticVolumeSize
elasticVolumeSize.description: Maximum size allowed for a volume in bytes. Valid values are in the range 1GiB to 16TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

elasticVolumeFilePath.title: File Path
elasticVolumeFilePath.description: A unique file path for the volume. Used when creating mount targets. This needs to be unique within the elastic capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisibility.description: Controls the visibility of the volume's read-only snapshot directory, which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots.

values.name: Hidden
values.description: Value indicating the read-only snapshot directory is not visible

values.name: Visible
values.description: Value indicating the read-only snapshot directory is visible

elasticCapacityPoolList.description: List of elastic capacity pool resources

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

zones.description: Availability Zone. For zoneRedundant service level pool, minimum three zones required in a region.

serviceLevel.title: serviceLevel
serviceLevel.description: The service level of the elastic capacity pool

values.description: Zone redundant storage service level.

totalThroughputMibps.description: Total throughput of the pool in MiB/s

subnetResourceId.description: The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/elasticVolumes, this is used by all the volumes within the pool

currentZone.description: Indicates the current zone of the pool. This can be changed for zoneRedundant service level pool with the changeZone action

activeDirectoryConfigResourceId.description: The Azure Resource URI for an Active Directory configuration. This is used by all the SMB volumes within the pool

changeZoneRequest.description: Changes the zone for the Zone Redundant elastic capacity pool

newZone.description: Availability zone to move Zone Redundant elastic capacity pool to

ruleIndex.description: Controls the priority of the export policy rule. When connecting to the volume the rule with the lowest index that applies to the connecting client is used

unixAccessRule.description: Specifies the Unix file access level for the volume. It encompasses both read-only and read-write permissions. Additionally, NoAccess can be set to block all access to the volume

values.name: ReadOnly
values.description: Clients connecting with this rule will only have read access to the volume

values.name: ReadWrite
values.description: Clients connecting with this rule will have full read and write access to the volume

values.name: NoAccess
values.description: Clients connecting with this rule will have no access to the volume

nfsv3.description: Allows clients to access the volume with the NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Clients can connect to the volume using the NFSv3 protocol.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Clients can't connect to the volume using the NFSv3 protocol.

nfsv4.description: Allows clients to access the volume with at least NFSv4.1 protocol.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Clients can connect to the volume using the NFSv4 protocol.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Clients can't connect to the volume using the NFSv4 protocol.

allowedClients.description: Client ingress specification for the export policy as list of IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names.

rootAccess.description: Indicates whether root access to the volume is granted to clients affected by this rule

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Root user access is enabled for clients affected by this rule

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Root user access is disabled for clients affected by this rule

elasticMountTargetProperties.description: Contains all the information needed to mount an elastic volume

ipAddress.title: ipAddress
ipAddress.description: The mount target's IPv4 address, used to mount the volume

smbServerFqdn.title: smbServerFQDN
smbServerFqdn.description: The SMB server's Fully Qualified Domain Name, FQDN

elasticVolumeDataProtectionProperties.title: DataProtection
elasticVolumeDataProtectionProperties.description: Data protection configuration option for the volume, including snapshot policies and backup.

snapshot.title: Snapshot
snapshot.description: Used to apply a snapshot policy to a volume.

backup.title: Backup
backup.description: Used to configure backups on an elastic volume.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

mountTargets.title: Elastic MountTargets
mountTargets.description: List of mount targets that can be used to mount this volume

elasticProtocolTypes.title: protocolTypes
elasticProtocolTypes.description: Set of support protocol types for the elastic volume

values.name: NFSv3
values.description: NFSv3 protocol type

values.name: NFSv4
values.description: NFSv3 protocol type

values.name: SMB
values.description: SMB/CIFS protocol type

smbEncryption.description: Used to enable or disable encryption for in-flight SMB data volume. This flag can be modified during Elastic volume update operation as well. Only applicable for SMB protocol Elastic volumes.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Value indicating the SMB encryption is enabled

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Value indicating the SMB encryption is disabled

smbEncryption.description: Used to enable or disable encryption for in-flight SMB data volume. This flag can be modified during Elastic volume update operation as well. Only applicable for SMB protocol Elastic volumes.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Value indicating the SMB encryption is enabled

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Value indicating the SMB encryption is disabled

elasticVolumeRevert.description: Reverts the elastic volume to the specified snapshot.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results

value.description: A list of elastic snapshot policies

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results

elasticSnapshotPolicyProperties.description: Defines an automated snapshot schedule and retention policy for an elastic volume. This resource specifies when snapshots should be taken (e.g., daily, weekly, or on specific days) and how long each snapshot should be retained. It is used to automate data protection and disaster recovery by maintaining point-in-time copies of the volume.

policyStatus.description: Configures if the snapshot policy is enabled on the volumes connected to the policy.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Value indicating the policy is enabled

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Value indicating the policy is disabled

elasticSnapshotPolicyVolumeList.description: Elastic volumes associated with elastic snapshot policy

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

elasticResourceWeeklySchedule.description: Weekly Schedule properties, make a snapshot every week at a specific day or days

days.description: Indicates which weekday(s) snapshot(s) should be taken, accepts a list of week day names in english

values.name: Sunday
values.description: Take a snapshot each Sunday

values.name: Monday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Monday

values.name: Tuesday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Tuesday

values.name: Wednesday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Wednesday

values.name: Thursday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Thursday

values.name: Friday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Friday

values.name: Saturday
values.description: Take a snapshot on each Saturday

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

daysOfMonth.description: Indicates which days of the month snapshot (1-31) should be taken, accepts a list of integers

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken
Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

elasticSnapshotResourceId.title: Elastic Snapshot Resource ID
elasticSnapshotResourceId.description: Resource identifier used to identify the Elastic Snapshot.

BackupResourceId.title: Backup ID
BackupResourceId.description: Resource identifier used to identify the Elastic Backup.

elasticResourceTags.description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

checkElasticResourceAvailabilityResponse.description: Information regarding availability of a resource.

isAvailable.description: True indicates name is valid and available. False indicates the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

values.name: True
values.description: Value indicating the name is valid and available

values.name: False
values.description: Value indicating the the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

reason.description: Invalid indicates the name provided does not match Azure NetApp Files naming requirements. AlreadyExists indicates that the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable.

values.name: Invalid
values.description: Value indicating the name provided does not match Azure NetApp Files naming requirements

values.name: AlreadyExists
values.description: Value indicating the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable

message.description: If reason == invalid, provide the user with the reason why the given name is invalid, and provide the resource naming requirements so that the user can select a valid name. If reason == AlreadyExists, explain that resource name is already in use, and direct them to select a different name.

resourceEtag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

value.description: A list of elastic region information

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

elasticRegionInfoResource.description: Details regarding elastic region info Item.

elasticRegionInfo.description: Contains information about the logical availability zones available within a specific Azure region for a given subscription, used to determine where elastic resources can be provisioned.

availabilityZoneMappings.title: Logical availability zone mappings.
availabilityZoneMappings.description: Lists the logical availability zones in the specified region and indicates their current availability status for the subscription. This helps determine which zones can be used to deploy or elastic resources.

availabilityZone.description: The identifier of the logical availability zone within the region (e.g., '1', '2', '3').

availabilityStatus.description: Indicates whether the specified availability zone is currently available for provisioning elastic resources for the subscription.

values.name: Available
values.description: The availabilityZone is available

values.name: Unavailable
values.description: The availabilityZone is unavailable

value.description: A list of elastic Backup Vaults

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

elasticBackupPolicyResourceId.description: ResourceId used to identify Elastic Backup Policy

elasticBackupVaultResourceId.description: ResourceId used to identify Elastic Backup Vault

ElasticBackup.description: Elastic Backup under an elastic Backup Vault

creationDate.title: creationDate
creationDate.description: The creation date of the backup

snapshotCreationDate.title: snapshotCreationDate
snapshotCreationDate.description: The snapshot creation date of the backup

completionDate.title: completionDate
completionDate.description: The completion date of the backup

backupType.title: backupType
backupType.description: Type of backup Manual or Scheduled

values.description: Manual backup
Scheduled backup

elasticVolumeResourceId.description: ResourceId used to identify the Elastic Volume

snapshotUsage.description: Manual backup using an already existing snapshot. This will always be CreateNewSnapshot for scheduled backups and UseExistingSnapshot/CreateNewSnapshot for manual backups

values.name: UseExistingSnapshot
values.description: Value indicating an existing snapshot is used.

values.name: CreateNewSnapshot
values.description: Value indicating a new snapshot is created.

elasticSnapshotResourceId.description: ResourceId used to identify the elastic snapshot resource. This is required when an existing snapshot needs to be used for creating a manual backup

elasticBackupPolicyResourceId.description: ResourceId used to identify the elastic backup policy

volumeSize.description: Specifies if the backup is for a large volume.

values.name: Large
values.description: Value indicating backup is for a large volume.

values.name: Regular
values.description: Value indicating backup is not for a large volume.

assignedVolumesCount.description: The number of volumes currently using this backup policy.

policyState.description: The property to identify whether backup policy is enabled or not

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Value indicating the policy is enabled.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Value indicating the policy is disabled.

value.description: A list of elastic backup policies

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

ElasticBackupPolicyPatch.description: Elastic Backup policy Details for create and update

ElasticVolumeRestorationState.description: The current state of the restoration process.

values.name: Restoring
values.description: Value indicating that the volume is currently restoring.

values.name: Restored
values.description: Value indicating that the volume is restored.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Value indicating that the volume restore has failed.

ElasticVolumePolicyEnforcement.description: The property to decide policy is enforced or not on the volume

values.name: Enforced
values.description: Value indicating the policy is enforced on the volume.

values.name: NotEnforced
values.description: Value indicating the policy is not enforced on the volume.
